The Acueduct of Segovia

20 centuries ago

See on Wikipedia
01 jan 2019

The Aqueduct of Segovia (Spanish: Acueducto de Segovia; more accurately, the aqueduct bridge) is a Roman aqueduct in Segovia, Spain. It is one of the best-preserved elevated Roman aqueducts and the foremost symbol of Segovia, as evidenced by its presence on the cityâ€™s coat of arms.
